Flatten a list of rsgeo vectors

Source: R/utils.R
flatten_geoms.Rd

Flatten a list of rsgeo vectors

Usage

flatten_geoms(x)

Arguments

x

an object of class rsgeo

Examples

pnts <- replicate(
  10,
  geom_point(runif(1), runif(1)),
  simplify = FALSE
)

flatten_geoms(pnts)
#> <rs_POINT[10]>
#>  [1] Point(Coord { x: 0.8209462941158563, y: 0.6470601938199252 }))   
#>  [2] Point(Coord { x: 0.7829327622894198, y: 0.5530363116413355 }))   
#>  [3] Point(Coord { x: 0.5297195801977068, y: 0.7893562316894531 }))   
#>  [4] Point(Coord { x: 0.023331202333793044, y: 0.47723006503656507 }))
#>  [5] Point(Coord { x: 0.7323137386702001, y: 0.6927315564826131 }))   
#>  [6] Point(Coord { x: 0.4776196221355349, y: 0.8612094768323004 }))   
#>  [7] Point(Coord { x: 0.4380971072241664, y: 0.24479727703146636 }))  
#>  [8] Point(Coord { x: 0.07067904714494944, y: 0.09946616017259657 })) 
#>  [9] Point(Coord { x: 0.3162717071827501, y: 0.5186342631932348 }))   
#> [10] Point(Coord { x: 0.6620050764176995, y: 0.4068301871884614 }))
